channel.title: My Personal Stock News
channel.description: Aggregated news from yfinance for my portfolio

item.title: [AV.L] How The Latest Price Target Shift Is Rewriting The Story For Aviva (LSE:AV.)
item.description: Why Aviva’s latest price target shift matters now The latest change in the price target for Aviva puts fresh focus on how analysts are reassessing the story behind the stock, even without a clear, published rationale attached to the move. With no detailed commentary provided on what is driving this revision, you are left reading between the lines and weighing what it might signal about expectations for the business. Stay tuned to see how you can keep on top of future price target updates and...

item.title: [INTC] Podcast: Stocks Rise as Tariff Tensions Cool
item.description: The gains occur as investors look for more details about President Trump's desire to annex Greenland. Plus, Intel predicts further losses next quarter in an after-hours earnings report. And shares in Abbott Laboratories fall after the company misses sales expectations.

item.title: [INTC] Intel Returns to Losses as Supply Shortages and Spending Weigh on Q4 Results and Forecast
item.description: The troubled chip maker has seen its shares rise with AI demand and new investors, but revenue sagged 3.9% year-over-year to $13.7 billion.

item.title: [INTC] Intel Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
item.description: Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) executives used the company’s fourth-quarter 2025 earnings call to highlight progress on an internal reset, improving execution on new process technologies, and accelerating efforts to meet what management described as intense AI-driven demand that remains constrained by supply.

item.title: [INTC] Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures inch up as Trump Greenland drama marks latest volatile week
item.description: Wall Street is taking a breather following a rollercoaster week defined by Trump's on-and-off behaviour regarding Greenland.

item.description: Wall Street is taking a breather following a rollercoaster week defined by Trump's on-and-off behaviour regarding Greenland.

item.title: [INTC] Markets Up on Decent PCE & Earnings. Q4 After the Close: INTC, COF, CSX
item.description: Year over year PCE moved back up to +2.8% after dipping 10 bps the prior month, and Intel sells off even after beating estimates in Q4.

item.title: [INTC] Intel (INTC) Reports Q4 Earnings: What Key Metrics Have to Say
item.description: The headline numbers for Intel (INTC) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended December 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

item.title: [INTC] Intel Stock Sinks on Weak Outlook. CFO Says Chip Supply Will Improve Later This Year.
item.description: Intel stock fell sharply on Thursday after the chip maker offered disappointing guidance for its first-quarter revenue. The company reported adjusted earnings per share of 15 cents in the quarter versus Wall Street’s consensus estimate for 8 cents, according to FactSet. Intel shares fell as much as 10.9% following the company’s earnings release Thursday evening.

item.title: [INTC] Dow Jones Futures Fall After Stocks Extend Rebound, Tesla Rallies On Self-Driving News; Intel Dives Late
item.description: The stock market extended its Greenland bounce, with Tesla rallying on big self-driving robotaxi news. Intel tumbled late.

item.title: [INTC] Intel shares plunge on earnings expectations
item.description: Intel shares dove more than 10 percent Thursday despite the struggling US chip maker doing better than expected in the recently ended quarter, as its revenue forecast disappointed investors.While the depth of losses beat market expectations, Intel's revenue forecast for the current quarter fell far short of what Wall Street analysts were predicting amid recently raised expectations for the company.

item.title: [INTC] Intel (INTC) Beats Q4 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
item.description: Intel (INTC) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +86.10% and +2.29%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

item.title: [INTC] Why Intel Stock Is Crashing in After-Hours Trading
item.description: Intel exceeded analysts' Q4 2025 expectations, so what's driving the after-hours sell-off?

item.title: [INTC] Intel Struggles to Meet Demand, CEO Says After Earnings
item.description: Intel Corp.&nbsp;gave a lackluster forecast for the current quarter because supply shortages are making it harder to meet customer demand. Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan told Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow that demand is "quite strong." Ludlow reports on "Bloomberg The Close."

item.title: [AAPL] Apple's reported moves could mean John Ternus will be next CEO
item.description: Apple (AAPL) reportedly quietly expanded the role of the company's hardware chief John Ternus, who is seen as a top contender to succeed Apple CEO Tim Cook, according to reporting from Bloomberg. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to take a closer look at what the report means for the iPhone maker and investors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

item.description: Investing.com -- Intel Corporation (NASDAQ:INTC) shares fell 4% Thursday after the chipmaker issued disappointing first-quarter guidance that overshadowed better-than-expected fourth-quarter results, as the company continues to navigate supply constraints while transitioning to new technologies.

item.title: [INTC] Intel stock drops on weak outlook: Analyst reacts to Q4 earnings
item.description: Intel (INTC) stock is under pressure after the company's weak outlook overshadowed its fourth quarter results that beat on the top and bottom lines. TECHnalysis Research president Bob O'Donnell joins Market Domination Overtime to share his instant reaction to the legacy chipmaker's earnings print. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

item.title: [AAPL] US stocks rally again after Trump backs off Greenland tariff threat
item.description: Global stocks rallied Thursday, lifting US indices for a second straight day after President Donald Trump dialed back tariff threats on Europe over their opposition to a US takeover of Greenland.But relief came Wednesday when Trump backed down on threats to seize the Arctic island by force from ally Denmark and retracted his tariff threat.

item.description: Chipmaker Intel beat estimates for the fourth quarter but badly missed with its guidance for the current quarter. Intel stock fell.

item.title: [INTC] Intel: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
item.description: The average estimate of 16 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 8 cents per share. The world's largest chipmaker posted revenue of $13.67 billion in the period, which also beat Street forecasts. Fourteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $13.37 billion.

item.title: [INTC] Intel stock falls after Q1 outlook disappoints
item.description: Intel (INTC) reported fourth quarter adjusted earnings of $0.15 per share versus an estimate of $0.09. However, it's first quarter earnings and revenue outlook were shy of Wall Street estimates. Market Domination Overtime Anchor Josh Lipton reports the breaking details. item.title: [AAPL] Apple Expands Hardware Chief’s Role in Latest Sign of CEO Candidacy
item.description: Cook, who has led Apple since 2011 and turned 65 in November, quietly tapped Ternus to manage the company’s design teams at the end of last year, according to people with knowledge of the matter. The responsibilities have special significance at Apple. The role was held by Jony Ive, Jobs’ longtime design partner, until his departure in 2019.

The iShares Semiconductor exchange-traded fund is up 51% over the past 12 months, bolstered in recent weeks by Intel’s sudden surge. Intel is getting love for its new processors and positive comments from President Donald Trump, while AMD has, in comparison, flown under the radar to start 2026.

item.title: [CRWD] The Age of AI Agents Brings a Risk No One Is Prepared For
item.description: Artificial-intelligence companies have promised that 2026 will be the year of agents: Software that can use AI language models to autonomously execute a complex series of tasks from simple instructions. The most prevalent use for agents today is for making software. With enough of a budget, a single developer can orchestrate teams of agents to work on existing codebases or even to start a project from scratch.
